text:
Shilixiang Mala Hotpot is a decent choice for enjoying a flavorful mala hotpot.

The dishes are satisfying with just the right amount of spice, and the ingredients are fresh. The service is good, with staff being attentive and friendly, which adds to the experience. While the ambiance is simple, it's a good spot for a casual meal if you're nearby and craving mala hotpot.

The instant noodle wasn't cooked,

The mala "sauce" not the best I ever had..

Pig stomach got odour taste, not clean..

Variety of dishes to choose..

I just ordered mala on grab and chose self pick up option. It's $24.80. When I reached home and open the container, there is no chilli and mala spice at all. The whole dish just look very white. Basically it just taste like fried noodles with ingredients. I can't even finish it because there is no taste and I just spend $25 on tasteless fried noodles. I'm so angry cos my dinner is ruined. Did the cook forget the chili and mala spice????
Generous portions. Rather slow on preparing the dishes, but tastes on point.

The taste is decent but they are not honest with their business. Happened to observer a couple of times when they switch the selected ingredients inside the kitchen to smaller portions even though they charged u based on the initial weight.
